title: Rapid Arterial oCclusion Evaluation (RACE) Scale for Stroke
desc: The Rapid Arterial Occlusion Evaluation (RACE) Scale for Stroke predicts the presence of large vessel occlusion (LVO) in patients with acute stroke.

orgreference.text: Pérez de la Ossa N, Carrera D, Gorchs M, et al. Design and validation of a prehospital stroke scale to predict large arterial occlusion: the rapid arterial occlusion evaluation scale. Stroke. 2014;45(1):87-91.

RACE Scale scores ≥5 were found to have the best predictive value and while protocols vary, it is generally recommended that patients with scores ≥5 are directly referred to a stroke center with endovascular capabilities.

inputs.tips_en: To evaluate for agnosia (left hemiparesis) vs aphasia (right hemiparesis)

inputs.name: aph
inputs.tips_en: Instruct the patient: (1) “Close your eyes.” (2) “Make a fist."
